artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Jōshūya Kinzō
catalogue_raissonne: Ukiyo-e shūka 14 (1981), Hiroshige list, p. 249, ōban #65.2
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Kyūka sanpuku no shogetsu ni/ take sakugo no kaze wo fukumi/ gentō sosetsu no kanchō ni/ matu kunshi no toku wo arawasu (The hottest days of summer tells you/ how cool the breeze blowing through a bamboo forest can be felt./ The color of pine remains green even in a cold morning in the middle of winter,/ which teaches you how unchangable a person of virtue is.)

Minamoto no Shitagō (poet\'s name, not written on the print)
911-83, One of the Sanjū rokkasen

from Wakanrōeishū vol.2, Miscellaneous

Dr. N. Hayashi, Oct. 2007
markings: Censor: Kiwame; publisher\'s seal: Jōkin (Jōshūya Kinzō)
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Anthology of Japanese and Chinese Poems for Recitation (Wakan rōei-shū 和漢朗詠集)
title: Pine Tree
